r0QcHGi4q0KiDPcvAogr5g.text: The restaurant is set up to be inviting and roomy. The server really loves her job so it made our visit really nice. The food took a long time to come considering it was lunch hour on a work day. I had a disappointing bison burger. The bun was stale and dry, the frozen burger was definitely rare although ordered medium. There was approximately a 1/2 tsp of hatch peppers and two pieces of onion. Really disappointing. Although The server rocked, the system of having runners was lacking. Eight minutes for a coffee reheat and water refill?  Five minutes for the sour cream to come for for the baked potato (which had been requested when order was placed)?    I will give the establishment a second try to be fair but will not order the burger, tortilla soup (salty) or baked potato.  Will probably go with an appetizer or flat bread.

photos.caption: Photo of BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Wonderful bison burger

kS6brxmwHCUdwaNFIKo_0w.text: Had a great time with friends.  John was our server, was absolutely fabulous and attentive.  Offered many good suggestions. Nick, the GM, came around, was concerned and really seemed to care about his customers.  The food was fabulous. Had the brussel sprout and the fried zucchini straw appetizers. They were fabulous!  The prime rib was wonderful and, of course, the pizzookie was amazing!  Will definitely be back!  And will request John as our server!

-U2w5KVTP4EJ5EztqmVlJA.text: Fun atmosphere and awesome food. Very friendly staff.  John was our waiter and he took great care of us. Ask for him if you stop in!

9iM4_lZhTv5WMDjyA2rUhA.text: when in Pittsburgh the table gets carded for drinks? when they are senior citizens? The waitress said it is some law? like Giant eagle in the Market Place. The food was good but I will never be back because of your misinformation.

hDSIe-mWJ7jbrX6g3BvVyg.text: This place is fine--good mojito.  Food for the most part is ok, consistent.  Big menu--maybe too big--so many different food styles...so wonder how they can master so many--I had a salmon salad once...fish was way too fishy smelling!  So not fresh--not even freshly frozen--ugh.  Will not order it again, yet I love a nice piece of salmon on a salad...so I now stick with basics...pizza and burgers here...sometimes chips and queso is a mix bag...comes out not real hot sometimes...or the chips are cold...or sometimes cheese is hot and chips are cold... I like that they have as set up where anyone brings your food...when it is ready, someone arrives with your food or drinks...vs waiting for your server to free up--then things get dried out or cold.... Not bad for a chain.

HkljfuCWn2sIYmTHNSEThw.text: John from the upper St Clair restaurant recommended the zucchini appetizer.  It was delicious.  Thanks John

N4Vqx1_KK_sllFqqotaf_A.text: My parents RAVE about BJ's. I'm not always a huge fan of chains, but I did like this place. The building is huge, and has a lot of seating.  The bar is seat yourself.  We grabbed a booth in the bar easily during the dinner rush.  The menu is massive, so prepare to be a bit overwhelmed.  We started with a brussel sprouts appetizer.  Almost half of the sprouts were charred and over cooked. The sprouts that were cooked well were delicious.  We didn't say anything because they were very busy.  Our server was very attentive, and always there to help us!  Next, a few of us had caesar salads.  It was a bit overdressed for me.  The dressing was very potent, and the salad was soggy.  Finally, we had pizzas all around the table.  Gluten free and regular.  I can only speak to the gluten free pizza.  It did the trick, but it wasn't the best GF pizza that I've ever had. They also have GF buns.  I'll certainly try this place again, but wasn't overly impressed. Again, the service was EXCELLENT!

0DOaEauT5DW3OZFRVqwVZA.text: I just got home from lunch at BJ's.  A group of us go there several times a year.  The service was awful.  Our waiter should be fired.  He tried to card my sister-in-law (who is 65) when she ordered a Pellegrino water and that was just the start of the issues.  After being there for over 2 hours before we received our check, we asked to speak with the manager.  He also should be fired.  When we described our experience, all he said was "it wasn't our best day".  The restaurant was only about 25% occupied.  It's not like it was a busy Friday or Saturday night.

Glui_LRVu4Nu11PQuqa7Rw.text: First let me say that the selection and the food is great! But the service needs work. With this location being new they may just have a few kinks to work out, but both times we have gone we waited at least 15 minutes before being acknowledged by waitstaff and taking our drink order. I watched a few tables near us actually get up and leave. Also both times are appetizers came out after our meals. I am not going to write BJs off just yet because as I said earlier the food is good and the food and drink menu is huge! Hopefully the service will get better with time.

nX3pWHvTBXUJ6BeJcDNoXw.text: Went here about 2 weeks ago, manger came over and talk to us like we were children. (I was with myself and two others) Very unprofessional for a new opening restaurant in the area. I can't say anything bad about the food. Just the fact that that happened would really make me think twice about returning.

X_pUfVOmODfmlxHPJt-fwQ.text: I've been here a few times and have not been disappointed. Yes, it's still a chain, and I typically don't go to chain restaurants. Why would you with all the other choices in Pittsburgh? I was so pleasantly surprised when I went for the first time though. Their pizza is awesome, tacos are great and my fiance even had a pasta dish that was really good! Their beer is good and I like the other crafts they have on tap too. Someone is making good selections to have on draft. I was shocked to see such a low rating for this place! If you hate waiting for a table, make a reservation like you would have to do anywhere else in pittsburgh! Or get the app and get in line when you leave your house. Definitely try it if you haven't been! Only thing I would change is a little better service. It's not bad, but it isn't stellar either.

ZjVl3JTov_J8ZwWd16iOZg.text: The atmosphere is fun, but the food is sub-par. Service varies from good to decent. Great beer selection.

FmPVwrK7omnGznPe8F7cLw.text: A BJs recently opened in McCandless Crossing near our home. We've gone a few times because we really enjoy the food, however the service is always so horrible. We recently went to the BJs in the South Hills and I was interested in seeing if our experience would be different. It wasn't. The service was super slow and inattentive. We never got our appetizer. Had to ask for a refill from the bar several times and soft drinks/water cups ran dry without refills. They brought out the wrong flavor boneless wings, then charged us for both when we asked to keep the mistake wings since they would just be wasted anyway. We asked to speak with a manager after the waitress told us she wasn't allowed to take it off the bill, and the manager was very short with us. She did take the charge off our bill, but you could tell she just didn't want to deal with us. As a chain restaurant, you'd think they'd have the management and service down pat, but that just isn't the case with BJs. We've now been to two of these restaurants and both had the same poor service. Since this has been our experience across two restaurants and perhaps 6 visits, this issue is a management issue, not a server issue. They are either too short staffed for the number of tables they have or aren't giving their servers adequate training. Don't come here unless you have lots of time to kill and plenty of patience.

F6Gd94Dj8VPGkPcuebaWMA.text: Equivalent to any chain with mass produced over salted food. Not horrific but no different than a TGIF or Applebee's

iKENAJyfrtA173ZIqLEVxg.text: Back again because I like the food choices.  I must say service is still terrible.  It wasn't busy it was 11:00 pm. Bartenders last night 12/9 can't get any worse.  I'm speechless...well maybe not let me elaborate.  Before we sat down I told them there was a mess (food, etc) under bar stools but they did nothing about it. The guy started off ok but disappeared for a half hour after taking my drink order & half my food order and not my friends...the other bartender didn't bother to check on us she stayed at the other end of the bar.  Had to call her down to finish getting waited on.  When he finally returned he stayed at the other end of the bar talking to people and never checked on us for more drinks till last call so you know what...no more drinks and no tip!  Tips are earned and should not be expected!  Polite is good but inattentive when not busy is unacceptable.

5jkwGkkMDXajbzD_pfCJPg.text: I am not going back here for sure. Went with family on Friday night, there was 45 minutes wait. The food was okay, beers were terrible. A server spilled food all over my wife's purse and her work clothes. Nobody even asked us if we would like them to take care of dry cleaning the clothes. It was raining, so my wife brought her umbrella along and forgot it at the table. We called next day afternoon, and the manager said they don't have it and can't do anything about it. Looks like they don't care about stuff their customers left behind by mistake. Or they hire people that like to steal things their customers left behind by mistake.

VcxfOc9ESlBNof05tqJ1pA.text: Overpriced and underwhelming. Was told 15-20 minutes for wait. Got text table was ready four minutes later. Trouble is I already ran over to Dicks... had to wait for another table when I got back 15 minutes later. Sampled the Hopstorm and Piranha and they tasted identical and neither had any hop flavor. Just malt. Luckily they had Fatheads Trail Head. It arrived about 30 seconds before my food. $10.25 for two tacos. The shrimp was good. The mahi mahi tasted fishy like they pulled it out of the Mon. Could get 3 just as good tacos at BWW for 7 bucks. Chicken alfredo was good but it's hard to screw that up, especially at 14 bucks.  $37 for two plates and 1 beer. Don't get your hopes up unless you like crappy beer and overpriced food.

turm4xcrfaKgqrr3bLQBjA.text: While grabbing lunch here with a client, I had a waitress accidentally drop a tray of waters next to me with a glass falling on my shoulder and table.  The waitress was extremely apologetic and tried to do everything she could to make the situation better.  The reason for the poor rating has nothing to do with the service or the wait staff.  The reason is due to the manager that was on the floor.  She came over and after my client joked with the waitress about getting a free round of drinks for me having to sit there with a cold shirt for the entire meal.  The manager said she would take care of things and in the end gave us a $9.95 cookie for free.  Not only do I feel this is insulting but it shows how out of touch and cheap the management is.  I do not wish to get a call from the manager on duty or the GM, but when you have a customer ring up a $165 bill, $10 off the top is not much and shows that you are more concerned with your bottom line for every transaction than actually being sorry for a mistake that is your restaurants fault.

1wAXODw4bO6Fx2kODT82-A.text: Sat at the bar. All the bartenders were very attentive. Their own beer is fantastic! The bartender got my food order incorrect but he quickly fixed it. Overall great experience will definitely come back

vHc5nuKmoCACgXWT0X0pmw.text: Absolutely horrible, service is terrible and food a 2 out of 10.  This is my third visit, keep hoping for a positive enjoyable experience, never again.  The waitress gave us silverware 3 times, no clue what she was doing!  The jambalaya salad was nothing more than chili pepper dumped on the shrimp, horrible.  My son had a medium steak, yes I know this is not a steak house, however it was leather, my dog wouldn't eat it.  We got the check before desert, call me crazy but bad food and a server with no clue for $110.00.....your right I am crazy for trying 3 times, never again.

T6r0pPl6s72inTjZGZLfZQ.text: Beer is great...food, so so. We ordered cheese sticks and calamari and they brought us one set and another set about 10 minutes later!?!?!  Spaghetti and meatballs is a little spicy but good. The pizza, which they are known for, is mediocre. Both the flat bread and the deep dish seem undercooked.  Service needs lots of work. And be careful in the bar area, something is up with a very slippery floor.

1NALjf9PxPTLNEei9doRMg.text: Over priced with small portions and shite service, a bud/miller ect domestic draft 4 bucks... their craft beers is so so.

1I3awLwOitZecf5IRYjjUQ.text: One star is generous for this place. It was new and clean. That's where it ends. Our waitress was not familiar with the menu and left mid meal. I had to ask 2 other waiters to find my soup order. Even though menu is extensive we had the basics. Caesar salad was made with ice burg (who does that?) the clam chowder was pastie and overly salted. The signature "new sandwich" was simply a variety of meat on soggy bread. No flavor and dry. Very underwhelmed. Lastly, after our original waitress left, we were pretty much on our own & even had to request to pay our check. I probably won't be back because in addition to the service and poor quality food it was overpriced.

cc0SIwk_g1YeoIznizwwZg.text: Food pretty good not worth wait. Takes forever to get a beer. I've been here 3 times looking to have a few but by the time they get here I'm ready to go

34kenFi3yVsxXjwJGC2sAA.text: Food and beer was reasonably priced and very good. We had called ahead to put our names in for a table and they had no record of us calling. They still sat us in 15 minutes when the wait was probably at least an hour. Other than that issue which I'm sure will get worked out once the restaurant has been open longer, this place is great.

Qst7USer7-L-f0CfbkXz6w.text: Never go here. Service is terrible. Took 3 hrs. Wrong meal. Finally just wanted to leave. Bill was wrong and took 30+ min. Have tried two different restaurants. Same.

PRB6zvxk0YPLhJCCHwATpg.text: I first experienced BJ's at their Chandler, AZ location when we were living in neighboring Ahwatukee.  I liked it then and I like it now.  I love their "house" beers and I don't have to argue with my family because there is truly something for everyone.  Want a fish taco?  Fine.  Want a steak?  Fine.  Want a pizza, Fine..... I personally eat the avocado egg rolls as my dinner because you get two huge ones that seem to be stuffed with an entire Avocado each and they have a nice spice to them.  I miss fresh Avocados from my years in Phoenix area.  The ones you buy at Market District or Trader Joes suck.  Apparently all the good ones go to BJ's because their Avocados are Southwest-worthy.  Right now the restaurant is packed from "eating with the elderly" time through closing because it is a new and different restaurant in the South Hills so be prepared for a bit of a wait.  If you are a 4 or under party, the bar area is walk-in with tables.  Gotta love PA, the kids can sit in the bar area!  Good for us!  As far as the quality of the food - if you like Houlihans, you will like BJ's.  Similar broad-spectrum menus and quality of food.

BsIgLMw31UlKXX2-jQMhXg.text: We always love BJs at south hills! John was our server in the bar seating area, he was excellent drinks were never empty and the food was hot and quick. We even got chips n salsa since they were still making the cheese dip for the nachos! It was happy hour and it was half off pizza and the pizza is excellent! I have more than enough for my lunch tomorrow and I'm excited!

pMHVp6-xSA21qQ9FzjheTg.text: Was good when it first opened,used to go on a regular basis for the shoe string fries, burgers and pizza. Haven't been back in the past nine months or so since the overall quality went down for the price. May eventually try it again in the future.  I have been to other locations around the country and this is the only one I have disappointed with.

HwxtQm3o4jPWE6CIJiBRGA.text: If you ever want a late night snack go to BJ's. Some great nights have ended with me and the boys gathered around the table going in on some pizooki's. I'd also like to add that if you get anything other than a pizooki you're crazy. The food is very average at best but I just can't stop going because the pizooki's are too gosh darn good.

6zkB_UYmDkgOY3W1a8eo3A.text: I have been to this location a few times before and was very happy with my experience unfortunately today that changed.  I had my daughters birthday celebration at BJ's with a party of 11.  Half of the group ordered sandwiches and all of bottom buns were moldy!  They were very apologetic and brought out extra French fries since the sandwiches were no longer wanted.  They also Gave us a few free desserts.  I do not think I will return.  Someone in the restaurant told us the moldy buns were reported to them the night before and they still served them!

pQyrZMTlKPtIhGPbETfcpA.text: Great hang out place!! Never knew this place was here but you definitely need to check it out. Although the reviews were quiet low, I just had to try it for myself. They have a nice beer selection (with sampling) and a lot of TVs in case that you want to watch the game. I do have to say that the menu is overwhelming since it's the size of an encyclopedia (maybe I'm exaggerating) but I couldn't decide since there were many good selections. I ended up getting the shrimp scampi and for appetizers we got the original wings and some cauliflower dish. The pasta was decent with a generous portion but it was a bit oily. The wings were good! Very juicy with a drizzle of sauce and ranch/hot sauce on the side. My favorite dish was the cauliflower, it kind of tastes like curry and had a really good flavor! It gets super packed here in the evenings.

tMglwyEjdeEDORfmYFiHpg.text: I really wanted to like this place, but the service ruined the experience for me. The food was pretty good... the avocado egg rolls were phenomenal & pazooki (they're infamous desert) were exceptional. Everything else was ok. Their beer was decent, but nothing to write home about. As an out of towner, I expected more. But I can honestly admit, our service ruined it for us.

SkReLxxaHmWlagmZzEjlfg.text: John the server is AMAZING! One night my friends and I came not knowing what to expect, he made our experience beyond all expectations. Having friendly servers who are able to interact and be efficient at the same time is something you can't get anywhere. He suggested the boneless wings and the Pizookia (a pizza cookie with ice cream!!) and they were out of this world!!! He later told us that he was a Virgo and after this experience we call him the 'virgo king'- can't wait to go back ALL the time :)

FV4Cg5Ne5cKrQFG-GoN6Bw.text: Food this time was very good, service was even better. Bar selection is great. It's a decent place to go grab dinner. We like it here. Parking is easy.

ncQGXv7h-1Lgbys2uqtWtw.text: John is a fabulous waiter! Very enthusiastic and friendly. The prime rib is amazing and we absolutely love the pizookies! Jason and Dan, the managers are great as well!

zrVnj86F4KynrgwOnB5rWA.text: I always order the parmesan crusted chicken. At least once a month. However yesterday when I ordered it to go I was VERY disappointed. I always get extra lemon Chardonnay butter sauce I can't eat it without the sauce. I got home and the sauce tasted like garlic sauce. I didn't get any hints of lemon at all, no acidity. So when I went back for the CORRECT sauce I tasted it and it was the same sauce I got early. The take out girl said that the prep cooks make it different sometimes. The manager was also just sitting at the bar watching and not saying anything. How do you allow this? I understand if it's a little different but this tasted absolutely nothing like the actual sauce taste. Therefore, I wasted almost $19 on something I won't be eating and I will not be eating for a while. Very disappointed.

Sfbbd2PC4oHnIZ_rafvyrw.text: Love this place. Great food, excellent service! We had John this time and he was the BOMB, so fast and friendly. Highly recommend!

-d3Azebz3gIL0Eh598tUWQ.text: Ordered take out from them, this is a $14.50 order. I find it hard to believe this is a full meal. If this was an appetizer I'd be okay with it. But for a full meal, No way. Called and asked if there are different sizes but they confirmed this is the "full" sized order. Whatever you do don't order the Enlightened Spicy chicken and noodles if your hungry.

-QOltjKNyfNkAn8pTeVKKw.text: This is a ok restaurant. The service is par and so is the food. The portion size is big which is a plus. The design of the place is very nice and modern looking. Overall not a bad place but there are definitely better.   Update(1-1-2019) I picked up a large cheese deep dish pizza and this is what I got. It was god awful , honestly a joke. _FDRdAsRySlwIJaLMnNyPA.text: I know that it may be hard to believe. You would have to experience it yourself. But ....the BEST PRIME RIB EVERRRRR!!!! Thanks Chef Jeff!! Also the best SERVICE EVERRRRR! For real. Thanks Server John!!! This place shouldn't be missed. Food, service, atmosphere wowwww!!!

Tr5pWkjxo-yxIvxXelUakw.text: Was a little skeptical even eating here Today due to some of the reviews, however we had amazing service I'm pretty sure her name was Katie. The food was really good as well. We had the deep dish pizza. Love the house beer sampler as well, I'd stop back for lunch anytime. Probably try the burgers bc they looked just as good

Sp2dK9l5f4iH3TKvscHS-Q.text: I've been here a few times now some more busier times than others and some trips with two to four people. The times when it's actually really busy it's terrible the staff at the front are very useless and every time I've made a reservation by my self or attempt to make one with them because there's a long wait it's never ready when they say it is. I've gone here multiple times and they had lost my reservation I assume was the issue or giving to someone else. My first few trips where solid I don't have many complaints the food was all good from the burgers to the flatbread and the piezookies are great. But recently after a bad trip here I'm extremely disappointed. My and a friend came here for a meeting and the waitress we had was absolutely terrible. She kept messing everything up i asked for a water with nice and lemons she brings a glass of water over with ice and no lemons. My friend got a appetizer for him self I had a bite of it and it was fine it being the chips and cheese. For the main dishes I got a meat pizza with the homemade meatballs and sausage and ham and what not. The pizza it's self was ok I don't really see what all the rage is about it being "deep dish". It came out warm but no piping hot. My friend got the wings BONE IN she brings out boneless. On top of that he asked for sauce on the side and got them tossed. I mentioned something to the server about it and she kept saying how she was new and just came off training a few days ago. My guest said it was fine but it's upsetting when you really talk about a place a lot but don't get what you want. My big issue was she shouldn't have came out of training if she's not ready yet to be on the floor interacting with guest. Nothing was ever done so that was a bummer. We both got a piezookie and that was ok. I got the cookie and cream one and it was kinda burnt and stuck To the pan. My guest got the brownie one and said it was okay. He seemed very disappointed that they didn't come out in cast iron pans just cheap aluminum. Overall I'll probably end up coming back here because my girlfriend likes it but if I had to pick coming back by my self I wouldn't come back after that last experience and nothing being done.

nFwiUAZgRG7U7vw6r5-0xQ.text: The last few times I went here I was unsatisfied with the extremely lengthy wait time and service, but this time I am pleased to say it seems as if they have excelled positively in this area to make the restaurant much more enjoyable! My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday night and they said it would be 40 min. We looked around the self seating bar area and a nice man from the wait staff proactively helped us find a table as well. Another wait staff told us he just cleared off a table in the area that we probably would not have noticed if he did not approach us. This was an upgrade from the last time we had to wait for a table. Luckily we only waited 10 min this time! Service was great, as well as food and drinks. I got a blueberry cider and loved it! Definitely recommend this drink. My Parmesan cruchicken dinner was also delicious, as well as the chocolate chip pizooki of course. We will be back again!   Updated review: 2019 We went here on another Saturday night around 4:30 thinking we would be ahead of the usual crowd-wait time as usual was 80 min. We put our names on the list and ran some errands. We ended up waited 105min! Much longer than they said it would be. After waiting an incredibly long time for dinner, they texted me that our table was ready. I go up to let them know and he tells me it's still not ready. Not sure what happened but we weren't exactly thrilled in the first place. Just to get drinks it took another 15 min to be waited on. Our waiter was very friendly through. I ordered tortilla soup and a buffalo bleau burger. Both were very good but my soup came out at the same time as my burger and it was cold. I didn't mention anything since I didn't want to wait any longer than we already had tonight. I enjoyed the fries as well and they do have great ranch. If you download the app you get a free pizooki which was nice, but that also took another 25 min after we cashed out for the night. Unfortunately we will not be returning because time and time again service has been slow and wait times have been some of the longest in Pittsburgh that I've been to in a long time.

7dJwA6AjDgHPaO6mXptcTg.text: I love stopping at BJ's. The food is always so good! The root beer glazed boneless wings are a must! I love their brisket burger and their pizza is so good. There's nothing I would not recommend from there. I've had their beer and it's good but surprisingly their black cherry soda is so good. If you have a sweet tooth their pizzokies with hit the spot. Sign up for their app and get emails for coupons!

FmKfLj5R2_i9J9eu1mG3BA.text: BJ's is an unexpectedly well-done restaurant chain. With a classically oversized and all-inclusive menu, I was a little skeptical. But after a couple visits, I have to say, everything I've had was quite different and really yummy! Just give yourself a lot of time to mull it all over...you'll be satisfied with what you get.  Less than satisfactory, however, is their own beer. I would more likely go with one of the other big craft guys on tap. I know they're a big chain, but I think a brewhouse should be able to round up some local beers too.  It's always packed, given the fact that it's one of the very few restaurants in Upper Saint Clair, so be prepared to wait or make a reservation. It's a really open echo-y building which makes it very loud and really supplements the "big box" chain feeling.

oKOvZcHnTUvs8L0f2b6UMw.text: I came to PA from LA for New Year's Eve and chose bjs for a good birthday/nye dinner.   Let's get started...My waitress. Skinny, Older lady, not sure of her name, was rude to me multiple times for no reason. The place wasn't packed so I don't know what her issue was but she should definitely be re-evaluated by her boss because she lacks in people skills.   I ordered food, pointed to what I wanted on the menu and read it out loud and she said "so what do you want because you're a low talker and I can't see whats on the menu"  Strike 1.  We never got silverware when we sat down so through our appetizers we had no napkins or utensils. when I received my meal I asked for silverware and she yelled at me saying "can you just wait until after I get all your food out?!" In the rudest tone ever and loud in my face.  Strike 2.  I ordered a chicken sandwich and received a beef burger, which was disappointing because I can't eat beef and besides that I wasn't even hungry after the bad energy the waitress gave me. So I ended up not eating or saying anything because the lady was so rude I didn't feel comfortable confronting her. I planned saying something to another waitress but no one passed me to say anything.  Strike 3.  We got a birthday cookie for my friends birthday and she didn't even light the candle! She said she couldnt find a lighter ... uh Never heard that one before! Strike 4!  Awful experience, her attitude literally ruined my night and the candle thing was a huge let down considering we were there celebrating a birthday.  I can't even comment on the food because I didn't eat anything except some nachos which are kinda hard to mess up only having few ingredients. I can say that everyone who did eat burgers complained about their stomachs hurting because they were way to greasy and flavorless at that.   So Overall I won't be going back.

pcCfPWrN9YnaSkB0HJea5g.text: So here's the thing about BJ's. The food is absolutely incredible. They always have great beer selections. The tavern cut pizzas, the burgers, the sriracha queso - all staples. BUT - it's nearly impossible to eat here because of how terrible their waiting system is designed. Particularly around dinner. They have a "preferred waitlist" that serves basically no function. You put your name on a virtual list using their app, yet it essentially does nothing. Multiple times I've gone with my family for dinner and we've had to just leave because of the wait. The app will give you an estimated wait time, but the time doesn't actually start until you get to the restaurant - which makes no sense. It's really a shame because the wide assortment of food and great beers would have me eating there a few times per week - if I could get in. So my best advice? Go for lunch, as long as it's not a normal lunch time when there's a chance it could be busy.

xKJoKKWVMLFjmQCYUvKm6Q.text: Great selection of drinks. Bar service really depends on who you get, some are great and others you can tell do not want to be there. Food is also amazing.

Gxme9hhsdOHM9ZfT0bHxJg.text: I would normally have a picture of my food (chicken quinoa bowl) but I devoured it too fast. The chicken was cooked perfectly. The bartender was friendly and attentive even though she was busy. Great place!

b2ayaLFWJELDWr7Hy47WNA.text: My wife and I feel like we were served by robots. The server stared at her little high tech gizmo as she took our order and never really looked up at us. Her voice was monotone. Everything took like a couple uneasy minutes too long. Like have you ever sat in a place and felt like you were being ignored and you were just about to stand up and leave without ordering and then from out of nowhere your server is hovering over you? Creepy. Then the server asked if we needed refills. We replied yes and she once again began playing with her little gizmo. Several minutes later an indentured servant would appear with our flat sodas. Our server never touched a glass a plate it was like she was too good for it. Then when I paid her fancy gizmo couldn't read my card so she told me my bank, dollar bank, wasn't as high tech as her gizmo. Man eat a bag o ****! Plus the food wasn't any better than applebees or fridays.

JhM2GVjVm3g8f5iiXkrCYg.text: This place has thee most AHHHHHMAZING burgers!!! This is the only place we will go to get a good burger and we don't really live close but it's worth the drive. Just wish it was a little bit bigger, must go there!! Wish I could give more stars! Put one in a Robinson it would make a killing out here!

U2IPEXFhtzM-3ZyDzKYodA.text: My good friend and I were shopping at the village mall and stopped into bjs for dinner.  We sat in the cocktail area and had Marla as our waitress and she was awesome. Super attentive and pleasant. She was very helpful picking items off the menu. Audree the manager stopped by our table to see if we were enjoying ourselvesand she was also very pleasant and helpful.  All around this place had great food and staff and plays great music! I highly recommend it!

c0ttDQ4FY_P9_0e9qR9sjA.text: Love the menu choices with some healthy options. I enjoy the peach drink with no sugar.  So hard to find I. Any other place .  Also I love the look of the place .  Their Mediterranean pizza was delicious.

DXnh8Tq0r_VragZ82KFtEA.text: For a first trip in as an out of towner, I really enjoyed my experience. I sat at the bar, and having Amy take care of me was awesome. She is obviously super knowledgeable, from beers to food, super helpful with her co-workers, and clearly cares about her guest's visit. When I am back in town I will be sure to come in again!

Vok8pWpfw6-YyybRO9Fjcg.text: I went there with my wife tonight. We order iced tea, brussel sprouts. And a thin pizza. The sprouts were delivered by someone who was not our server.  We got the sprouts before anything else, and by anything else I mean water, iced tea, any thing. I asked to speak to the manager who was standing right behind our table, and no such luck. What ever he was doing must have been earth end important because he never came. The tea finally came but I had to tell the waitress that i no longer wished to dine at that establishment. I felt bad for the waitress as I'm sure it was not her fault but we never set food in that business again.

4dA8Gg0bwoekgqixzX7M0A.text: Yea the food was really good. We ordered many chicken dishes and deep dish pizza too. And ambience was also so nice. But 1 thing I noticed which is not major is the crowd and noise. I felt little discomfort while having a chat with my family. Other than that rest all was superb.

opl3vT9YGQDqB4FbjcNSLQ.text: Very good pizza in a cool setting. The challenge is that this place can be extremely crowded even during off hours. And, it can be a little pricey for what you get. But there's no denying that their pizza is excellent.

p9i8poKjfR2XpZTODYVyFA.text: Enormous menu that the servers don't understand. Equal with the drinks. Food and drink can be good but you have to get lucky.

D4QcaH5QT5_paQ0C25QJRA.text: Why give BJ's a Star? Other day went for lunch and I didn't like menu. Im not particularly picky but the prices and smallness of dishes wasn't worth it. So I stared at menu wondering ? I'll just try 1 thing& I had calamari . I love Calamari but BJ's was like they dipped gum bands in batter- tough & they must be frozen tasted that way. I never ate her before and won't be back! I left and had a great lunch at bonefish at least there it's fresh!

MEdoOWNmaIDo3leHbfHVXQ.text: First visit to the new bjs at south hills village, the call ahead seating apparently has no affect as we waited an hour after calling in 2hrs  edited our arrival time.  Food quality was good, although some of the portions were a little misleading in the menu.  The biggest deduction was for safety, as all of the floors were a complete ice-rink!  And it was just as bad when we left as it was when we arrived!

0X5yfIsPbn8Zum1G9TPG0w.text: They opened on Monday and so far everything was great! The service was good and so was the food! I had the kale and brussel sprouts salad with chicken and my boy friend had the California chicken. Definitely will be back back!

moDsEMm5BnMcl9dnBE6kOg.text: This area was in a desperate need for a place like this.  It's a chain without the cliche chain feel.  The food was really good.  Fried artichokes are a must! And their thin fries were perfect.  Our server, Chelsea rocked and went the extra mile for us.  The gm came to our table and was so welcoming. To top it off, they had guys with giant umbrellas outside walking people to their cars. Quality place, quality staff, will def be back!

aIBujnbHTL26QX0gPdj6Lg.text: Not sure I will ever go back here. I had a bad experience. It took a long time to get sat and once we were sat, no one acknowledged us. Our waitress forgot about us the whole time and we didn't receive great food or service. The two stars are for the delicious cocktails I had at the bar.

5IP80DyG-dOOkB19RGMTsA.text: The starter salads served were great, but my friend was served her salad five minutes before my salad came to the table. The bison burger was disappointing. The slaw served with it was terrible. The waitress had little patience with my elderly friend. I have dined at the BJ's in Columbus, Ohio and it is always wonderful. I'm very disappointed with the service and the food and will not be back.

gw3HWtYrHHUNLnOOc8a1tA.text: Wait was very long even with call ahead. Appetizer came same time dinner. Food was just okay.

RqiBrgR666hJhPkvB-4yKg.text: I wish I could give this place 4 stars because the beer and food deserve it. The disinterested bartenders and total lack of customer service deserve 2 stars. They appear to be more interested in congregating near the service area then waiting on paying customers.  They lack personality and people skills and are better suited for a service only bar then one with actual patrons who want to grab a drink and have a meal. Not sure we will ever return.

kCadC3927Q5PaFVjo1krSg.text: EDITED review: 1 Star to 4 stars  After giving the location a couple more chances, I can say for sure that the charm begins to show! The burger nights bring the restaurant portion to life, and the atmosphere is unique, which is especially impressing for its genre.  Give it a go, and definitely go for the burgers, and make sure to get your fries well done.  Still don't order the Brussels sprouts, we had another bad experience with those.

smuln8um6fp2Wwbn9nI1Fg.text: In writing this review, and the many to come I, Jeffor Gregor, embark on a journey in good faith with the overall goal of informing the masses of the establishments in which they dine, on their positive and negative aspects.       To begin I plan on diving into the subpar facets of this franchise, as is commonplace when informing of news. For my accomplices and I found the service to be insufficient on the particular day. The waiter who served us, let his name be absent, started off on a good foot; serving us our beverages in a timely fashion and appearing in good spirit. This soon would take a turn for the worse when approximately three quarters of an hour passed until my acquaintances had received board. To worsen the situation, the very sought after desert "pizookie", was received after half an hour of waiting.     To refrain from the unfavorable aspects of this venue, I will go on about the favorable parts over the course of my experience. In short, the water was splendid, as was the caesar.      Thank you for taking your time to read my review. Bon Voyage and Bon Appetit.  Signed,  Jeffor Gregor

_h5i37uT_Tr5-3fHoKQX-g.text: I went here tonight with my daughter, son-in-law & 3 grandkids. We had a great meal & a great time!   The fried calamari appetizer was very good.   My Santa Fe salad was excellent. Good reviews from the table also for the barbecued chicken salad & the barbecued ribs.   Service was excellent, too.   Our only concern was the wait to get seated. Next time we'll make a reservation on Open Table.

9k4KEjIoxykz7f7PE5KAUg.text: This was my first time in BJ's and I was honestly thoroughly impressed. It was so much nicer inside than I expected and they had a very impressive bar. We came on a Tuesday evening around 7:30 and were seated immediately. Our server came over and explained all of our drink options- they make their own soda! I'm not a soda drinker, but that was very cool to me!   I reviewed the menu (which is HUGE, by the way) and everything looked so good. I had a hard time picking what I wanted! The menu was very good at describing all of the dishes and included a fair amount of pictures of the food as well. I ended up ordering the jalapeno burger (substitute with the veggie burger), a Caesar side salad, and a side of the honey sriracha Brussel sprouts.   The service here is QUICK. My side salad was out in no more than 2 minutes. It was perfectly made, too. Just enough dressing & toppings along with the lettuce. Within 10 minutes, the rest of our food was out. The burger was perfect, I just need to ask for more of the chipotle mayo next time because I didn't think there was enough of it. I love that it was topped with fried jalapenos, it was a nice touch! And the Brussel sprouts, oh my GOD. so good. They were cooked so perfectly and seasoned so well. The sauce on them was amazing, but again I had to ask for more of it because I didn't think there was enough on it.   Overalll, I will definitely be coming back. I will recommend this place for sure!

Q2BFznH0atirctxnpVbuQA.text: To whom it may concern, Bj's is the finest of establishments...but I must voice some of my grievances before praising this great hall of eating. With a heavy heart I must state that the forks do in fact have a slight curvature. Now, in contrast to my previous opinion I must state the obvious, the polarity of the water is facing directly north to south. This isn't found in many waters even the artisanal ones. Furthermore, the pyramid shape of the water glasses*dolphin noise*is an interesting take on the classic cylinder

g-xYEBpmnd9MnFX0ghR0Cw.text: I LOVE this restaurant! Service can be a bit slow, and there is usually a wait to be seated, but the extensive menu and quality of food really make up for it. Obviously they have a wide selection of beer, but the food menu offers just as much variety.   The avocado egg rolls are my favorite appetizer. Their pizza is also amazing! There is also a whole menu page dedicated to "enlightened" options a.k.a. healthier meals. We loved the poke bowl with buckwheat noodles and the quinoa bowl with chicken. Both were super delicious and full of flavor, while still being healthier options.   The portions are pretty large (I still had half of mine to take home for leftovers), but if you have room for dessert, you've got to try a pizookie. This is a warm oversized cookie served with scoops of ice cream on top... yum!   I recommend downloading the BJ's app, as you quickly rack up points for free items and discounts. You also can use the app to get on the preferred waitlist, so you don't have to wait as long to be seated once you get there.

Photo of BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Quinoa bowl with chicken

H7V2MQ8s9tE27WkJEh9hRw.text: Just had lunch with friends. John was our waiter and he was absolutely fantastic!! Thank you John, you are the best. Will definitely request you on future visits!

gtNWKW1XfclSHH6dNcnOKg.text: Review of the bar... Have you ever been here...?   There's Top Shelf on top of Too Shelf....!   Pick a whiskey, pick a bourbon, and I'll bet they have it, in seconds too.  The bar is spotless, bottles glistening to the point where I want to try EVERYTHING...!  My bartender for the evening was Michael and he was super.  Very friendly when he wasn't preparing drinks for the rest of the entire restaurant, not that the other guy was slacking cause he was bustin his ass too...  Great place to come & try a House Brew or a Mojito, like I had...

if65TQsRW4SnddSQBwoT0Q.text: John was a great server! He greeted us quickly upon us sitting down at our table. Our drinks came quickly and the kids had their appetizers fast. The appetizer also came out quickly!

Uu4xfqyAESrYMw-schB-kA.text: My last few times at BJs I was exceptionally disappointed. The first time I went the waitstaff was rude and barely checked on our table. The food wasn't anything to write home about it was painfully average. Additionally for the price you pay you would expect a bit higher quality of food. The atmosphere is nice. The most redeeming quality of this place is their renowned Pizookie and that was good and served warm.

V2GumRmcvFg9TvFCWrj5vw.text: Wonderful experience; great food, large variety on the menu, good prices. We had the best server, Blake, who made our evening a fun one, he was equally charming and efficient. Our party of five had spinach artichoke dip appetizers, steaks, pizza, salads, tacos, and ice cream desserts. Everything was delicious. Highly recommend!

FnTb27-TxARPolAk7POIGA.text: I hate chains, but I really don't mind this one at all. I've been here about 3 or 4 times now with my family, and each time I've gotten something that I really enjoyed.   Their brussel sprout salad is one of my favorite things on the menu, and it's not too fattening (they give you calorie info). Today I got the Santa Fe salad, and it was very good too. In the past I've ordered the buffalo burger, and I recommend that as well.  The amount of options on the menu are endless, and that's what I really enjoy about this place. If you're looking for healthy/gluten free/vegetarian options, they have them. If you're looking to completely pig out, they got you covered there too. Kind of reminds me of the Cheesecake Factory menu, but much simpler to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Santa Fe salad

LA_H97VmhH4tB2vO4yaIZA.text: Took 2 friends for their Birthday Dinner. Was the first time for both of them. Had call ahead seating, requested to have John's section. When the 4 of us arrived we were told John wasn't serving except for beverages same for LJ who was my second choice. We were seated in TJ's section. He was very informative  in explaining info to the friends that are new to BJ'S. All 4 of us ordered the prime rib. A little to fatty but was good just the same. Prepared the way everyone ordered. The only disappointment was couldn't get the baked potatoes. The 4 of us ended up taking our dessert to go.

_pieQmlnPUH1qSxrfD4ZCQ.text: Really good service and meal. We have a 3 year old son; the complimentary garlic knot and fruit as an immediate appetizer for him was invaluable. The server was very nice and accommodating, and despite the place being full, the food came out quick.  We started with the cheese curd, which were good and then had two types of pizza, if you like sauce get extra, but I thought both were good. Thin crust is good for 2 people with sides, deep dish medium could feed 4. We also got a beet arugula salad and couscous mac and cheese to try, both were good.  Tuesdays was $3 pizaookie, we got the monkey bread and chocolate chip....omg amazing!!! Overall really good experience. The price was about $60 without tip, but we were all stuffed and had pizza to take home.

CN9i6t1oW_Jp8qmSroopNg.text: Service at this restaurant was pretty good. I was greeted at the door each visit. The waiters were fairly attentive due to the amount of traffic was there. Food took a little longer then I expected. But again I do not fault them because of how busy they were.    During my first visit I order the Jambalaya. I was not a fan, the seasoning taste very generic, and the shrimp tasted as if it was quickly boiled rather then grilled. Which was to be expected when ordering a dish that requires a multitude of seasonings and spices. All of which I do not fault on their behalf due to this dish difficulty. Though priced at $18.25 I did expect a little more.   My second visit I ordered the Root Beer Glaze boneless wings. Which was excellent. The sauce that was used had an even balance of sweet and tangy. And the wings were were still crispy even though it was covered in sauce. Priced at $11.95 you will receive a substantial amount of wings for either a shared appetizer or a single entree. A friend of mine ordered a personal pizza which I a had the opportunity to taste. The pizza was perfectly sauced and cooked to perfection I highly recommend.   My third visit I order the Fresh Atlantic salmon it came with a side of broccoli and rice pilaf. It came with the option of boiled or blackened. I decided to get mine blackened. It was a descent dish, everything complemented the other well. The lemon butter add to the salmon gave a citrus accent to the bitter salmon. The broccoli and rice was good though I expected a bigger portion of rice being priced at $19.25.   For desert I order a chocolate chip pizookie which was free due to me downloading the app and becoming a rewards member. I highly recommend getting this dessert.  All in all this is a great restaurant for bar style foods with pricing more so on the high end considering it's portions. I recommend going but keep in mind that this is still a chain restaurant, apart from its extravagant multicultural menu.

rzckQORifM8lEv1iBI7oiQ.text: I wanted to write an update solely because of the one sandwich on their menu, the hand-pulled turkey dip.  This is one of the best sandwiches I have ever had.  I have always been a big fan of regular French dip sandwiches, but never came across the turkey version of one until bjs.  The turkey is incredibly tender and the onions and horseradish blend perfectly together for an incredible flavor.  On top of the great ingredients, they use a great bun which holds up to the ingredients, as well as the dipping into the turkey au jus.

Photo of BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Hand-pulled turkey dip.  One of the best sandwiches around.

Hx6-m20CZGgDqkoXVMFRhQ.text: I love BJ's Brewhouse mostly because they have such a huge menu, I think there is something for just about anyone here! Each time I've been here, the restaurant itself is always clean and the service has always been great. I understand that it's "chain-like" but that's not always a bad thing. I'm sure their food isn't the freshest, or local.. but it's still pretty high quality. I also am a huge fan of their extensive bar list, especially their beer!!

nmzQ7emKDhIYtCVjiAZobw.text: If you were engaging in an intimate relationship with    Your lover then I shall not request this establishment for that particular occasion, although the lighting is subtle it can be quite rigorous on the retina. Now if you were heading to a beach party then wanted a quick bite with the boys that I will suggest this wonderful and joyful venue. Although i wouldn't take my lovely escorts to this venue I would take my most sought after acquaintances. I must inform all of the public to my most enticing discovery. I bid thy farewell to all my most humblest of reviewers.

6S8dXH8YeRwpy1qcBnaQfA.text: This is my second visit to BJ's Restaurant for dinner.  We came pretty late, around 7:45 pm. We were surprised that there was still quite a line at that hour and we were quoted 15 minutes until seated.  I was frustrated because I was starving and I told my SO that even if we get seated it's going to take forever to get our food because the restaurant holds a ton of people and it was packed!    I can say I was completely wrong; we were seated quickly, our orders taken promptly, and our food came out one after the other (appetizer, then salads, then entree).  We hardly waited at all, yet our food was fresh and piping hot.  We got the provolone sticks appetizer, which was a bit pricier than I'm used to. Well, that's because there were 8 sticks to an order! They were hot and delicious and the homemade sauce was tasty.   I got the gut-busting Baked Ziti and it was delicious, but definitely a guilty pleasure!  My SO got the small deep dish pizza and it was still too big of a portion; one person should get a 'mini', especially if you order a side like a salad.   I definitely enjoy coming here. It's kinda like the Cheesecake Factory in that they have a TON of different menu items - all are unique and inventive. They also have a large beer selection (including their own recipes) if you're into that sorta thing.   I also suggest trying to hold back just a bit to save some room for dessert because they have warm deep dish cookies & deep dish monkey bread that is to die for.   Next time you're at the Village, give this place a try. EVEN if you see people waiting to be seated, they will surprise you with how efficient they run the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse - Upper Saint Clair, PA, United States. Baked Ziti w/ garlic knot

R85McsO-tqC0q-VrMkz8Tw.text: I have to update my review because my photos reminded me of what we ordered. The honey sriracha brussel sprouts were delicious and I recommend if you love vegetables like I do! I didn't notice much heat from the sriracha, but they were still very good. Husband enjoyed the blue cheese burger. The quinoa dish I had was just okay and I'd get something else next time.  The atmosphere felt like other similar chain restaurants to me. The food menu is huge with lots of beer options as well. Very busy when we were there early afternoon on a Saturday but we were seated and served quickly.  Prices average, about $40 for lunch for 2 including a couple beers, not including tip. Would come back if in the area with others who want to check it out.
